title: If I want to take the SAT again but already have a good essay score, will I have to retake the essay? - Quora

response.answer_text: Well!!This is difficult to answer. ....This is because it depends on the university. Every university has different criteria. So, even if anyone tells you something will not be 100% correct. What you can do is, visit the official website of your desired universities and check their admission policies and criteria. If they accept super-score then go-ahead or if they ask for all of your SAT scores then do that. Your admission to the US university depends on their criteria. In general, students have to re-take the SAT as the College Board doesn’t allow a student to improve the sectional scores separately. Look for the university criteria and then proceed accordingly. I hope you got the answer. Note: I am associated with Achievers’ Point.

It really depends on the college. Some colleges let you super-score (or cherry-pick) your essay score, along with the other sections (a better math score in one test but a better reading/writing score on another). Some colleges do not. Some other colleges make you submit every single score you took for the SAT, including for the SAT essay, so you can’t super-score any score. Some don’t require or don’t let you submit your essay score. Some let you super-score only your SAT multiple choice scores, and not your essay scores… Point is, if you see a college you’re interested in, just check their website and they’ll probably be clear on what you can and can’t do with your SAT score when applying there.
